course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Microelectronics Fabrication Technology
course.description: Process technologies in IC fabrication: epitaxial growth; chemical-vapor and physical-vapor deposition of films; thermal oxidation; diffusion; ion implantation; microlithography; wet/dry etching processes; process integration of MOS and bipolar technologies.

reviews.author: Chase Cheng
reviews.comment_content: Focus on the theories of semiconductor processes (oxide growth model/diffusion model/implantation model etc). It is a pity that the novel CMOS technologies are not involved in the course. The content  is kind of old-school compared with the similar course given in other university. The course is a prerequisite to work in NFF.
reviews.comment_teaching: Easy to understand. Some difficult content would be skipped.
reviews.comment_workload: The questions in bi-weekly homework and final exam rarely change in years. Final essay is an essay, and its topics are given by the instructor. First come, first choose.
